snippet: The State of California's licensing board is seeking to revoke Ernst & Young's license to practice accounting because one of its two predecessor firms had audited the failed Lincoln Savings and Loan Association.    Ernst & Young was formed last ye...
lead_paragraph: The State of California's licensing board is seeking to revoke Ernst & Young's license to practice accounting because one of its two predecessor firms had audited the failed Lincoln Savings and Loan Association. Ernst & Young was formed last year by the merger of Ernst & Whinney and Arthur Young. Lincoln Savings and Loan, a subsidiary of the American Continental Corporation, had been an audit client of Arthur Young in 1986 and 1987.
